conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.
Stream A is light blue, stream B is yellow, stream C is orange, and stream D is pink.
There are slanted barriers: green, gray, pink, and black.
Containers E, F, and G are located at the bottom of the image.

premise: Stream A flows down and encounters the green slanted baffle.
conclusion: Stream A is diverted to the left.

premise: Stream A is diverted to the left and flows along the green baffle.
conclusion: Stream A eventually reaches container E.

premise: Stream B flows down and encounters the gray slanted baffle.
conclusion: Stream B is diverted to the right.

premise: Stream C flows down and does not encounter any baffles.
Stream B is diverted to the right and stream C continues straight down.
Streams B and C merge and flow down the black slanted baffle.
conclusion: Streams B and C are directed into container F.

premise: Stream D flows straight down and does not encounter any baffles.
conclusion: Stream D continues straight down into container G.

premise: Stream A reaches container E; streams B and C merge and reach container F; stream D reaches container G.
conclusion: Most of stream A ends in container E; streams B and C merge and end in container F; stream D ends in container G.
